microtool.monte_carlo package¶

Submodules¶

microtool.monte_carlo.IO module¶

microtool.monte_carlo.IO.make_result_dirs(result_directory: Path, category_name: str) → Tuple[Path, Path]¶

Makes a subfolder in the result directory with catergory_name, and subsequently makes subfolders in that folder with names plots and data

Parameters:

  • result_directory – Path to result directory

  • category_name – name for the subdirectory to be created

Returns:

plotsubdir, datasubdir

microtool.monte_carlo.parameter_distributions module¶

microtool.monte_carlo.parameter_distributions.fit_gaussian(parameter_distribution: DataFrame) → DataFrame¶

Function that returns a nested dataframe containing the results of gaussian fit. :param parameter_distribution: :return: Nested dataframe containing df[parameter][‘mean’] and df[parameter][‘std’]

microtool.monte_carlo.parameter_distributions.plot_dataframe_index(df: DataFrame, index_name: str, ax: Axes) → None¶

Plots an index from a pandas dataframe to the given axes object :param df: The dataframe :param index_name: The index you wish to plot :param ax: The axes you wish to plot to :return:

microtool.monte_carlo.parameter_distributions.plot_parameter_distributions(mc_result: DataFrame, gt_model: TissueModel, symbols: Dict[str, str] | None = None, gaussian_fit: DataFrame | None = None, color: str | None = None, fig_label: str = 'parameter distributions', hist_label='parameter_dst', draw_gt=True) → Figure¶
Parameters:

  • mc_result – The result from a montecarlo simulation

  • gt_model – The groundtruth tissuemodel used in the montecarlo simulation

  • symbols – A dict mapping a tissuemodel name to another string used to format the plot

  • gaussian_fit – Result from fitting gaussian distributions to monte carlo result

  • color – Color used in plotting

  • fig_label –

Returns:

microtool.monte_carlo.parameter_distributions.scale(mc_result: DataFrame, ground_truth: TissueModel) → DataFrame¶

Helper function for rescaling the parameter distribution

Parameters:

  • mc_result – Parameter distribution which we wish to rescale

  • ground_truth – The ground truth tissue model w.r.t. we wish to scale

Returns:

The scaled distribution

microtool.monte_carlo.simulation module¶

This module contains all functions and classes involved in the monte carlo simulation of acquisition schemes and how the noise distribution affects the estimated tissueparameters.

IMPORTANT: Always execute run inside a if name main clause! otherwise the parralel processing throws a cryptic error

class microtool.monte_carlo.simulation.MonteCarloSimulation(scheme: AcquisitionScheme, model: TissueModel, noise_distribution: rv_continuous_frozen, n_sim: int, fit_options: dict | None = None)¶

Bases: object

run() → DataFrame¶
Returns:

save(datadir: Path, model_name: str, scheme_name: str) → None¶

Saves the montecarlo result and the scheme and model used during the simulation. :param datadir: A path with folder and name included

set_fitting_options(fit_options: dict) → None¶

See the fit options of the tissuemodel that is in use.

Parameters:

fit_options – Dictionary of fit options compatible with fitting routine of tissuemodel
